DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to collect data on the use of the SOLITAIR FR device for treatment of acute ischemic stroke with large artery occlusion i.e. to investigate, whether the application of SOLITAIR is a safe and feasible method for interventional recanalization of large vessels with favorable patient outcome in acute stroke therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Mechanical Recanalization With Flow Restoration in Acute Ischemic Stroke
DOC.criteria: Age 1885 years Acute ischemic stroke with occlusion if ICA, MCA, VA or BA (TICI 0 or 1 flow) within the first 6 hours Rapidly improving neurological signs NHISS>30 or coma Female patients, who are pregnant or lactating Use of warfarin anticoagulation with INR > 1.5 Platelet count < 30,000 Glucose < 50 mg/dL Life expectancy of less than 90 days Computed tomography (CT) or Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) evidence of hemorrhage on presentation CT showing hypodensity on presentation
